alert.note: Alert for Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 10 at 11:31PM EDT until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from recent excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Along Contentnea Creek between Wilson and Stantonsburg. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1126 PM EDT, gauge reports indicate flooding due to runoff from recent excessive rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wilson and Stantonsburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
